    • Constructor Detail

      • Visibility

        public Visibility()

      • Visibility

        public Visibility(boolean canSee,
                  boolean cannotSee,
                  boolean anotherRoom,
                  boolean straightForward,
                  boolean everywhere,
                  boolean chainSee,
                  boolean differentTiles,
                  boolean rangeDist,
                  boolean isChainedToTake,
                  int minMov,
                  int maxMov,
                  int maxDistanceToVisibleTiles,
                  int minDistanceToVisibleTiles)
        constructor of the class
        Parameters:
        canSee - true if player can hit visible players (see game rules for more details)
        cannotSee - true if player can hit not visible players
        anotherRoom - true if the targets are the rooms
        straightForward - true if the effect is on a specific direction
        everywhere - true if al the players can be selected (other constraints need to be applied)
        chainSee - true if the visibility of the effect starts not from the current player but from the player hit in previous effect
        differentTiles - true if effect can't hit players in the same tile
        rangeDist - true if effect hits all the players at a set range (visibility range)
        isChainedToTake - true if the current player for visibility can be re-selected
        minMov - the minimum movement for valid visibility of the effect
        maxMov - the maximum movement for valid visibility of the effect
        maxDistanceToVisibleTiles - the maximum movement that can be applied to a player in order to make him visible
        minDistanceToVisibleTiles - the minimum movement that can be applied to a player in order to make him visible

      • getTargettablePlayers

        public java.util.List<Player> getTargettablePlayers(GameManager gameManager,
                                                    Player player,
                                                    Effect effect)
        main method of this classes. It checks all the visibility constraints to check if there are possible players that can be targetted by the effect
        Parameters:
        gameManager -
        player - the current player for visibility
        effect - the current effect
        Returns:
        the list of players that can be targeted. This before more specific constraints about actions.

                                                          GameManager gameManager,
                                                          Effect effect)
        this method returns the directions that have possible players to hit
        Parameters:
        player - the current player for visibility
        gameManager -
        effect - the current effect
        Returns:
        the selectable directions

        public static java.util.List<Tile> getDirectionTiles(GameManager gameManager,
                                                     Player player,
                                                     int minMov,
                                                     int maxMov,
                                                     Direction direction)
        method that return the valid tiles in a direction
        Parameters:
        gameManager -
        player - the current player for visibility
        minMov - the min movement before the first valid tile
        maxMov - the max movement for a valid tile
        direction - the selected direction
        Returns:
        the valid tiles in a direction

      • removeNotValidPlayers

        public java.util.List<Player> removeNotValidPlayers(GameManager gameManager,
                                                    java.util.List<Player> targettablePlayers,
                                                    Player currentPlayer,
                                                    int minDistance,
                                                    int maxDistance,
                                                    Effect effect)
        this method removes the non valid players for the current effect or action, related to the parameters of the visibility and of the restricted visibility in the effect/action
        Parameters:
        gameManager -
        targettablePlayers - the currently selectable players
        currentPlayer - the current player for visibility
        minDistance - min distance at which shooting is valid
        maxDistance - max distance at which shooting is valid
        effect - the related effect
        Returns:
        the effectively selectable players

      • removeNotValidActionPlayer

        public java.util.List<Player> removeNotValidActionPlayer(GameManager gameManager,
                                                         java.util.List<Player> targettablePlayers,
                                                         Action action,
                                                         Player player,
                                                         Effect effect)
        method used to remove the not valid players related to the current Action
        Parameters:
        gameManager -
        targettablePlayers - the players that can be chosen before checking the action
        action - the current action
        player - the current player for visibility
        effect - the current effect
        Returns:
        the selectable players

      • removeNotReachableDirections

        public java.util.List<Direction> removeNotReachableDirections(GameManager gameManager,
                                                              java.util.List<Direction> targettableDirections,
                                                              Player currentPlayer,
                                                              Effect effect)
        this method removes the not selectable directions related to the current effect
        Parameters:
        gameManager -
        targettableDirections - the selectable directions before computation
        currentPlayer - the current player for visibility
        effect - the current effect
        Returns:
        the directions that can be chosen
